metadata.Title: CVE-2017-16671 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - high.
metadata.Description:
A Buffer Overflow issue was discovered in Asterisk Open Source 13 before 13.18.1, 14 before 14.7.1, and 15 before 15.1.1 and Certified Asterisk 13.13 before 13.13-cert7. No size checking is done when setting the user field for Party B on a CDR. Thus, it is possible for someone to use an arbitrarily large string and write past the end of the user field storage buffer. NOTE: this is different from CVE-2017-7617, which was only about the Party A buffer. It was discovered that asterisk did not properly check the length of certain input. A remote attacker could use this vulnerability to cause a denial of service (crash) or potentially execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16671` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

asterisk - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1.1ubuntu4.1+esm1
asterisk-config - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1.1ubuntu4.1+esm1
asterisk-dahdi - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1.1ubuntu4.1+esm1
asterisk-mobile - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1.1ubuntu4.1+esm1
asterisk-modules - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1.1ubuntu4.1+esm1
asterisk-mp3 - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1.1ubuntu4.1+esm1
asterisk-mysql - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1.1ubuntu4.1+esm1
asterisk-ooh323 - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1.1ubuntu4.1+esm1
asterisk-voicemail - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1.1ubuntu4.1+esm1
asterisk-voicemail-imapstorage - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1.1ubuntu4.1+esm1
asterisk-voicemail-odbcstorage - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1.1ubuntu4.1+esm1
asterisk-vpb - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1.1ubuntu4.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: asterisk package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:13.1.0~dfsg-1.1ubuntu4.1+esm1').
